IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE SALT LAKE ACTING COMPANY IS A PROFESSIONAL THEATRE FOR THE PURPOSE OF PRESENTING INNOVATIVE AND THOUGHT-PROVOKING PLAYS FOR UTAH AUDIENCES. THE ORGANIZATION EXISTS AS A GATHERING PLACE, A SPACE CREATED TO CELEBRATE THE COLLECTIVE IMAGINATION AND ENCOURAGE THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS. THE ORGANIZATION IS COMMITTED TO NURTURING AND EMPLOYING A COMMUNITY OF LOCAL THEATRE ARTISTS AND MAKING A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTION TO THE AMERICAN THEATRE THROUGH COMISSIONING, DEVELOPING, AND PRODUCING NEW PLAYS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE SALT LAKE ACTING COMPANY IS A PROFESSIONAL THEATRE FOR THE PURPOSE OF PRESENTING INNOVATIVE AND THOUGHT-PROVOKING PLAYS FOR UTAH AUDIENCES. THE ORGANIZATION EXISTS AS A GATHERING PLACE, A SPACE CREATED TO CELEBRATE THE COLLECTIVE IMAGINATION AND ENCOURAGE THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS. THE ORGANIZATION IS COMMITTED TO NURTURING AND EMPLOYING A COMMUNITY OF LOCAL THEATRE ARTISTS AND MAKING A SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTION TO THE AMERICAN THEATRE THROUGH COMISSIONING, DEVELOPING, AND PRODUCING NEW PLAYS.
IRS990.Description: DESCRIPTION OF SLAC'S ACCOMPLISHMENTS DURING THE YEAR ENDED AUG 31, 2010: IN ITS 2009/2010 SEASON, THE SALT LAKE ACTING COMPANY PRODUCED SIX PLAYS IN 185 PERFORMANCES FROM SEPTEMBER 1, 2009 THROUGH AUGUST 31, 2010. FIVE OF THE PRODUCTIONS TOOK PLACE IN THE 106-SEAT UPSTAIRS THEATRE, ONE IN THE 99-SEAT CHAPEL THEATRE. SELECTED FOR THEIR ABILITY TO RE-ANCHOR THE THEATRE TO IMPORTANT WORK AND RE-CONNECT IT TO ARTISTS, THE PLAYS WERE: THE CARETAKER BY HAROLD PINTER (SEP 16-0CT 11, 2009); MASTER CLASS BY TERRENCE MCNALLY (OCT 14-NOV 8,2009 (2 EXTENSIONS)); GO, DOG. GO ADAPTED BY A. GREGORY & S. DIETZ (DEC 2-27, 2009); TOO MUCH MEMORY BY MEG GIBSON & KEITH REDDIN (FEB 3-28, 2010); CHARM BY KATHLEEN CAHILL-WRLD PREMRE (APR 14-MAY 9,2010); AND SATURDAY'S VOYEUR BY ALLEN NEVINS & NANCY BORGENICHT (JUN 29-SEPT 12, 2010). THROUGH ITS NEW PLAY SOUNDING SERIES, SLAC OFFERED FREE STAGED READINGS OF: VIRTUE BY TIM SLOVER (10/26/09); PROPHETS OF NATURE BY KEITH REDDIN (2/15/10); AND THE PERSIAN QUARTER BY KATHLEEN CAHILL (10/26/10). THE PERSIAN QUARTER WILL WORLD PREMIERE AT SLAC IN FEBRUARY 2011. SLAC INTRODUCED ITS FIRST ANNUAL FRINGE FESTIVAL, SHOWCASING NEW WORK OF LOCAL PLAYWRIGHTS, FEATURING NEW PLAYS BY JULIE JENSEN, SAM WESSELS, AND STEVEN BROWN DANCE COMPANY. SLAC WORKED WITH OVER 145 THEATRE ARTISTS, INCLUDING OVER 50 ACTORS AND 11 PLAYWRIGHTS. ARTISTS INCLUDED: ALEXIS BAIGUE, COLLEEN BAUM, DANIEL BEECHER, MATTHEW IVAN BENNETT, BRIK BERKES, NATALIE BLACKMAN, DAISY BLAKE, DUSTIN BOLT, NANCY BORGENICHT, STEVEN BROWN, KATHLEEN CAHILL, SYDNEY CHEEK-O'DONNELL, BRENDA SUE COWLEY, JAMES CRAIG, JOE CRONIN, ANNE CULLIMORE DECKER, PAUL DORGAN, DAVID EVANOFF, STEVE FEHR, CHERYL GAYSUNAS, MEG GIBSON, SHANE HAAG, ALEXANDRA HARBOLD, KENT HAYES, JULIE JENSEN, VALERIE KITTEL, STEFANIE LONDINO, JAYNE LUKE, ALLEN NEVINS, DAVID MONG, SHANNON MUSGRAVE, NICK O'DONNELL, JESSE PEPE, JAY PERRY, JERRY RAPIER, KEITH REDDIN, GUS REYES, MAX ROBINSON, J.T. ROGERS, NATHAN SHAW, ARIKA SHOCKMIEL, AARON SWENSON, JOHN VREEKE, AND OTHERS. IN ADDITION TO SERVING ITS PRIMARY THEATRE AUDIENCE, SLAC DEVELOPED ITS OUTREACH PROGRAMS TO INCLUDE NEW AUDIENCES IN THE 09/10 SEASON. THESE EFFORTS - GEARED PARTICULARLY TOWARD GENERAL, YOUTH & STUDENT, AND SUBSCRIBER AUDIENCES - INCLUDED THE NEW THEATRE STUDENT ARTIST SERIES, A STEEPLY-DISCOUNTED SUBSCRIPTION FOR COLLEGE AND UNIVERSITYSTUDENTS ACROSS THE VALLEY; SLAC'S FIRST ANNUAL PROFESSIONAL CHILDREN'S PRODUCTION, INCLUDING FREE MATINEE PERFORMANCES TO 1,200 TITLE I ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS; SLAC'S ACTORS' COLLECTIVE, A RESOURCE FOR LOCAL THEATRE ARTISTS; EXPANDED DISCOUNT TICKET OFFERINGS, PARTICULARLY FOR STUDENTS AND THOSE UNDER 30; AND OUR ONGOING PARTNERSHIP WITH WASHINGTON ELEMENTARY SCHOOL, IN WHICH SLAC PROVIDES STAFF, SPACE, AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT FOR THEIR ANNUAL SHAKESPEARE PRODUCTION. SLAC ALSO CONTINUED TO SUPPORT LOCAL SOCIAL SERVICE NON-PROFITS BY PROVIDING COMPLIMENTARY TICKETS TO ASSIST WITH THEIR FUNDRAISING EFFORTS; AND OFFERED GREATER ACCESS TO ITS PRODUCTIONS THROUGH STUDENT AND UNDER 30 DISCOUNT TICKETS AS WELL AS STUDENT SEASON SUBSCRIPTIONS, ZAP FREE TUESDAYS, FACEBOOK MATINEES, AND 30-AND-UNDER RUSH TICKETS. IN CONJUNCTION WITH CHARM, SLAC PRESENTED A PANEL DISCUSSION ON MARGARET FULLER, THE PLAY'S PROTAGONIST, AND WOMEN ARTISTS AND PROFESSIONALS "IN A MAN'S WORLD". SLAC SERVES AS ONE OF THE RARE GATHERING PLACES FOR MATURE DISCUSSION AND DIVERSION IN OUR CITY, ENCOURAGING THE EXCHANGE OF IDEAS THROUGH ITS PRODUCTIONS AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS.

COLLEEN SORENSEN DON SORENSEN BOARD MEMBER BOARD MEMBER SPOUSE

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: ORGANIZATION'S PROCESS USED TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS PRESENTED AT AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MEETING, REVIEWED, AND APPROVED (IF NO CHANGES ARE REQUIRED). IN ADDITION, ALL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD RECEIVE A COPY OF THE FORM 990 FOR REVIEW.

ALL BOARD MEMBERS AND OFFICERS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR REVIEWING THIS INFORMATION AND PRESENTING IT TO THE FULL BOARD FOR RECOMMENDATIONS AND RESOLUTIONS. THE BOARD WILL DETERMINE A SPECIFIC RESPONSE TO BE TAKEN ON A CASE BY CASE BASIS TO ENSURE THAT THE ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT DOES NOT INTERFERE OR APPEAR TO INTERFERE WITH PRUDENT ADMINISTRATION OF THE ORGANIZATION.

THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CREATES A BUDGET, INCLUDING BUDGETING FOR THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION. INFORMATION USED IN DETERMINING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES HISTORICAL PAY, BUDGETED REVENUES AND EXPENSES, AND COMPENSATION GUIDELINES FROM TCG (THEATER COMMUNICATIONS GROUP). THE PROPOSED COMPENSATION IS PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD, WHICH IS INDEPENDENT. DELIBERATION AND DETERMINATION OF THE OVERALL BUDGET, INCLUDING COMPENSATION, IS RECORDED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.

THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CREATES A BUDGET, INCLUDING BUDGETING FOR THE OTHER OFFICER'S AND EMPLOYEE'S COMPENSATION. INFORMATION USED IN DETERMINING THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR'S COMPENSATION INCLUDES HISTORICAL PAY, BUDGETED REVENUES AND EXPENSES, AND COMPENSATION GUIDELINES FROM TCG (THEATER COMMUNICATIONS GROUP). THE PROPOSED COMPENSATION IS PRESENTED TO THE FULL BOARD, WHICH IS INDEPENDENT. DELIBERATION AND DETERMINATION OF THE OVERALL BUDGET, INCLUDING COMPENSATION, IS RECORDED IN THE BOARD MINUTES.
THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AT OUR OFFICES DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS.
